word: It has been a necessity to organize union conferences, that the General Conference shall not exercise dictation over all the separate conferences. The power vested in the Conference is not to be centered in one man, or two men, or six men; there is to be a council of men over the separate divisions.--Ms 26, April 3, 1903. [FOR FURTHER INFORMATION REGARDING ORGANIZATIONAL CHANGES MADE AT THE 1901 GENERAL CONFERENCE SESSION SEE THE SEVENTH-DAY ADVENTIST ENCYCLOPEDIA (VOL. 10 OF THE COMMENTARY REFERENCE SERIES), REVISED EDITION, PP. 1050-1053.]
